definition: Yuen Ren Chao (1892-1982), Chinese-American linguist
to surpass (old)
surname Zhao/one of the seven states during the Warring States Period (476-220 BC)/the Former Zhao 前趙 (304-329) and Later Zhao 後趙 (319-350), states of the Sixteen Kingdoms
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: I cannot but think of Prof.
sentences.chinese: 谈起方言，我不能不想起赵元任先生。

sentences.english: Chao acted as interpreter when Bertrand Russell took a lecture tour of China.
sentences.chinese: 当年英国哲学家罗素来华巡回讲学，赵元任担任翻译。

sentences.english: In Chapter three, the thesis discusses the national style of Zhao's vocals.
sentences.chinese: 第三章，赵元任声乐作品创作的民族风格。

definition: Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
Wen Yiduo (1899-1946), poet and patriotic fighter, executed by Guomindang in Kunming
Cai Yuanpei (1868-1940), liberal educationalist, studied in Germany, president of Peking University 1917-19, minister of education for Guomindang
Liu Shipei (1884-1919), Chinese anarchist and revolutionary activist
Feng Youlan (1895-1990), distinguished Chinese philosopher
Zhou Youguang (1906-2017), PRC linguist, considered the father of Hanyu Pinyin 漢語拼音|汉语拼音[Han4 yu3 Pin1 yin1]
Yan Fu (1853-1921), influential Chinese writer and translator of Western books, esp. on social sciences
Shiing-Shen Chern (1911-2004), Chinese-American mathematician
Ku Hung-ming or Gu Hongming (1857-1928), Malaysian man of letters, highly regarded for his literary works written mostly in English, and known for his monarchist views
Zhang Taiyan (1869-1936), scholar, journalist, revolutionary and leading intellectual around the time of the Xinhai revolution
Xu Zhimo (1897-1931), writer and poet

Zhou Zuoren (1885-1967), brother of Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅, academic in Japanese and Greek studies, briefly imprisoned after the war as Japanese collaborator, persecuted and died of unknown causes during the Cultural Revolution
Liang Qichao (1873-1929), influential journalist and a leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
Qian Zhongshu (1910-1998), literary academic and novelist, author of the 1947 novel Fortress Beseiged 圍城|围城
Lin Chia-Chiao (1916-2013), Chinese-American physicist, astronomer and applied mathematician
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
